result.execSummary:
The defendant James Edward Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
If agent feels that the defendant has completed all of the conditions prior to the 16 months of probation is up, they may contact the Court for earlier release.
PROBATION REVIEW  hearing November 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 36.

miscConds.notes: Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim unless the agent is in agreement and approved by the Court.  May have third party contact for visiting with his children.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges.  Civil judgment if not paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Edward Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. IS

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Benjmain Lindsay  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to12/18/15 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36
cab
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel, the victim and defendant as to sentencing.  
cab
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3  days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless the agent is in agreement and approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- If agent feels that the defendant has completed all of the conditions prior to the 16 months of probation is up, they may contact the court for earlier release.
 - Defendant may have 3rd party contact for visiting with his children.

Court ordered bail to be returned to whoever posted it.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2nd call. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessment contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 973.055(1) a class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is set for Jury Trial.  Defense ready to proceed.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has alternative theory of prosecution, case passed to allow state to confirm appearance of officer witnesses.  Defense motion to Dismiss. Case PASSED.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DUPLICATE FILE IN COURT. Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing to address the No Contact Order.  ADA advised the victim in the matter, NOT in court, is requesting modification of the No Contact orders to allow for third party contact for time with the children. Court modified the order to allow for third party contact for time with the children. Case adjourned for previously scheduled Jury Trial on 7/20/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Bail Hearing & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Bail Hearing & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM015954  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-25-15
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SJ or her child SJ and TB.

The Court no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Edward Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James Edward Jackson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
